main event: A pilot reported observing a metallic circular object over Gander, Newfoundland on 6 April 1955.
interesting points: The pilot detected the object on radar at approximately 30,000 feet., The object was described as metallic in color and circular in shape., The object appeared to oscillate slightly and traveled at an estimated speed of 1,000 miles per hour., The pilot attempted to close in on the object but lost visual or radar contact as it accelerated away., A total of four witnesses, including the pilot and crew, confirmed the sighting.
witness description: the pilot and crew of the aircraft
